Name: Bucket List
Description: You received a WavesLine message from an unknown sender
QuestDesc: You received a WavesLine message from an unknown sender

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The undersea tunnel I mentioned is just ahead. Please take me there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-This is the first time that I have looked upon this world from beneath the sea. It is much more beautiful than any picture stored in my system.

Dialogues.Speaker: Livery Applicator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's an old Mechascout like you doing here? Is there an issue with your chassis?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm here to ask for a new livery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Livery Applicator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... But I'm all out of paint supplies. The next batch won't come in until next week, so how about you return then?

Options.PlotLineKey: It won't last a week...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you need? We can collect them for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Livery Applicator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me think... Well, if you're in a hurry, I can write you a list.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please take me to the top of that greatsword, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want to do up there?
Don't do anything rash, now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I intend to experience the thrill of flying by jumping into the lake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In my database, I found a single word mentioned repeatedly in relation to complex human behaviors: Conquer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humans once feared fire, so they invented tools and learned to control it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humans aren't able to walk on water, so they built ships to cross the ocean.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Humans yearned for the sky, so they designed devices to achieve their dream of flight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though small, humans never stop conquering new territories. So, in my final moments, I too wish to overcome my own limits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if it comes at a price...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, I'm too obsolete to be equipped with a flight module, so I've never soared through the sky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the only way for me to fly. Don't worry, my cushioning module will keep me safe...

Options.PlotLineKey: But wouldn't that speed up your energy consumption?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the price I mentioned. Now let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, could you help me install this part?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Try installing the part.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You give it a few tries but ultimately fail to install the part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The connector seems to be deformed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But at least I've retrieved it. I'm only holding it, yet it feels like that hole in me has been filled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for helping. You must be tired from all this traveling. Come with me, there's a geothermal hot spring around here.

Dialogues.Speaker: System Notification
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mechascout. Codename: Robbie. Pressure and temperature module parameters remain within normal range. Core energy module is severely damaged.

Dialogues.Speaker: System Notification
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remaining energy at 59%. Estimated system uptime is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough. Deactivate self-diagonistics.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem to be damaged.
Shall I get an engineer from the academy to take a look at you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, but that won't be necessary. The academy's engineers have completed my servicing. My core module has been severely affected by the Void Storm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A full recovery is no longer possible. All I can do is watch as my energy reserves gradually deplete.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's no different than waiting for death!

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Machines do not know death. We are either "on" or "off."

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My responsibility is the safety of this area. I was switched on for that sole purpose, and I shall expend all energy reserves for that purpose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if most of my modules are nonfunctional...

Options.PlotLineKey: There is no purpose in staying here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Purpose... My system is unable to decipher what you are trying to convey.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Instead of staying put and waiting for your energy to drain, wouldn't it be better to put that energy into something meaningful?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Forget the tasks you were assigned at startup. Why don't you do something meaningful for yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meaningful...

Options.PlotLineKey: Something you've always wanted to do but never had the chance to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My system indicates you speak of something like a bucket list humans make. Machines do not have that privilege.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However... My system has not blocked this term or queries related to it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then perhaps your creator wanted you to have that privilege.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'd like to see the undersea tunnels. But my current energy reserves are insufficient for that journey.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me help you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just continue along this road. Don't worry, my remaining energy is enough to fulfill my final wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You follow the road with Robbie at your side, and you arrive at the highest point on the Sundermere.

Dialogues.Speaker: System Notification
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remaining energy below 5%...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your energy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deactivating all system notifications. Don't worry. Just focus on the matter at hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems this will be my starting point, and my finish line.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even now, I still fail to understand what you meant when you said that I should do something meaningful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You humans often consider love meaningful. My creator even wrote love into my underlying code, but I cannot understand it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet after just this single day, I've come to understand love a bit. I did many things for myself today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when I revisit the examples of love within my database, I put myself in their shoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've begun to understand hugs, kisses, and even the words used to express strong emotions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thus, I spent my last 1% of energy analyzing the behaviors I mentioned, and the outcome was:

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In order to learn to express love, perhaps we must first learn to love ourselves. Just like I did today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know how to hug, kiss, or produce beautiful and complex writing. I can only express love in one way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: 3+10i on an imaginary axis represents my wholehearted love for this world and my desire to protect it.

Dialogues.Speaker: System Notification
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Critical system notification. Remaining energy below 1%...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some humans wish for machines to continue in their stead. But for me, right now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope you will continue in my stead, go onwards with a machine's digital love for this world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's time for me to go, {PlayerName}. I'm leaving myself and this world in your hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's the temperature? Is it to your liking?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's all right.
It's like the baths of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, to tell you the truth, I'd love to try bathing in a hot spring. But I'm a machine and unable to perceive temperature changes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Water just feels sticky and slimy to me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Try searching for hot springs in your system?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. Searching... My database indicates that the warming sensation experienced by humans in hot springs is due to heat stimulating the skin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In machine terms, it's akin to internal electrical stimulation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe a Zip Zap can help?
Maybe a mech reindeer can help?
Maybe a Geospider S4 can help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's the temperature? Is it to your liking?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's all right.
It's like the baths of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, to tell you the truth, I'd love to try bathing in a hot spring. But I'm a machine and unable to perceive temperature changes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Water just feels sticky and slimy to me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Try searching for hot springs in your system?

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. Searching... My database indicates that the warming sensation experienced by humans in hot springs is due to heat stimulating the skin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In machine terms, it's akin to internal electrical stimulation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe a Zip Zap can help?
Maybe a mech reindeer can help?
Maybe a Geospider S4 can help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You summon a Zip Zap. It discharges an electric current into the hot spring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A noticeable sensation spreads through Robbie. It seems Zip Zaps are the most effective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feel a strong tingling sensation that intermittently moves along my internal wiring to reach every part of my body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thereafter, you try using all kinds of Echoes on it in the hopes of replicating the feeling of being in a hot spring...

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll record this rarely felt sensation in my database. Even in sleep, my data will be shared with the other Mechascouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... All robots should try relaxing in a hot spring. Be it a natural hot spring or one found in an apocalypse hotel after the end times.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to do more things that are beyond my system's parameters. Like getting a new livery... {PlayerName}, could you take me back to the Academy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You summon a Mining Reindeer. It assumes the hot spring is a mining site and begins firing laser beams into the water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A mild sensation spreads through Robbie. It seems Mining Reindeer are somewhat effective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I feel a faint tingling sensation that intermittently moves along my internal wiring to reach every part of my body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You summon a Geospider S4. It doesn't know what to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Robbie stares at it and feels nothing. It seems Geospiders are wholly ineffective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Robbie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Geospider? Hmm... I don't feel anything. Let's think of something else.
